New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers set a new franchise record with their 10th straight win by double digits.
This is the second time in franchise history where the team has two separate 10-game winning streaks in a season (2008-09).
Key Match Events: Darius Garland and LaMelo Ball engaged in a spirited duel that set the tone for the game.
Jarrett Allen quietly dominated the paint with a 15-point first half on 7-of-7 shooting and eight rebounds.
Garland led the way with 25 points, outdueling Ball, while Allen and Mitchell added 19 apiece.
Evan Mobley contributed 17 points and secured his 20th double-double of the season with 11 rebounds.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers were coming off a four-game road trip where they swept their Western Conference opponents.
The Charlotte Hornets were on a nine-game losing skid entering the contest.
Cavs swingman Max Strus emphasized the team's championship mindset and approach to each game.
Post-Match Reflections: Cavs coach Kenny Atkinson praised the team's maturity and focus, especially after returning from a nine-day road trip.
Darius Garland expressed his desire to be an All-Star and highlighted his healthy season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland's offense flowed seamlessly with assists on 29 of their 44 made baskets.
Charlotte leaned heavily on isolation plays from Ball and Brandon Miller, managing just 19 assists as a team.
